html: As a longtime advocate for those with mental illness, I fought in the New York State Assembly to pass Timothy's Law, which ensured that New Yorkers with mental health concerns are treated on par with those seeking physical health care. #WorldMentalHealthDay2018

html: When Medicare & Medicaid were created 53 years ago, most seniors couldn’t get health coverage. Today, Medicaid alone covers: 64% of nursing home residents 1.75 million US veterans 39% of US kids Millions of Americans can now get the care they need. That’s worth fighting for.
text:
When Medicare & Medicaid were created 53 years ago, most seniors couldn’t get health coverage. Today, Medicaid alone covers: 
64% of nursing home residents 
1.75 million US veterans
39% of US kids
Millions of Americans can now get the care they need. That’s worth fighting for.

I urge the Trump Administration to drop this charade and come to Congress with proposals that:
1. strengthen cybersecurity for critical infrastructure
2. sustain domestic nuclear supply
3. drive investments in our nation's energy grid to make it smarter, more reliable & resilient

html: Puerto Rico's blackout during and after Hurricane Maria, like most outages, was NOT caused by a lack of electricity generation. It was a transmission & distribution failure. After months of weak & inhumane crisis response, that has become a tragic and deadly government failure.
text:
Puerto Rico's blackout during and after Hurricane Maria, like most outages, was NOT caused by a lack of electricity generation. It was a transmission & distribution failure. 

After months of weak & inhumane crisis response, that has become a tragic and deadly government failure.

html: The leaked NSC memo outlining this energy bailout shows the Trump Administration has missed the point entirely, with no lessons learned or even a mention of the most devastating blackout in our nation’s history: the failure of #PuertoRico's grid during and after Hurricane Maria.

html: Let’s be clear, fuel assurance doesn't guarantee generation after a disaster. During the Polar Vortex, coal piles froze. Coal piles flooded in Hurricane Harvey. This response fails to address the real vulnerabilities in our grid, most notably weaknesses in distribution systems.

html: America is long overdue for an honest national conversation about securing, strengthening & modernizing our electrical grid. Instead, the Trump Administration wants to turn crisis procedures (e.g. after a natural disaster) into a multi-year bailout for uncompetitive energy.

Instead, the Trump Administration wants to turn crisis procedures (e.g. after a natural disaster) into a multi-year bailout for uncompetitive energy.

I’m voting “NO”

html: As a result, passing this #FarmBill would mean some 467,000 New York households will lose their eligibility for heating/cooling assistance and more than half will lose #SNAP benefits, a $270 million loss for our state.

html: The #GOPFarmBill would also sever the link between food assistance and heating/cooling support, a link that simplifies paperwork and helps the most vulnerable New Yorkers avoid the dangers of hunger and extreme temperatures.

html: If we want a competitive U.S. economy, a workforce that delivers day after day, great arts & literature, new ideas & innovations that better the lives of millions, it all starts with education. Did you have a teacher who helped you in your life? I did. I support teachers.
text:
If we want a competitive U.S. economy, a workforce that delivers day after day, great arts & literature, new ideas & innovations that better the lives of millions, it all starts with education. 

Did you have a teacher who helped you in your life? I did. I support teachers.
